meanings.definition: Relating to or living in the open sea, away from the shore.
meanings.sent1: The planktic creatures swam freely in the vast ocean.
meanings.sent2: The sailor marveled at the planktic life far out at sea.
meanings.sent3: The planktic fish threw a party in the deep blue sea.
meanings.sent4: The planktic birds soared high above the endless waves.
meanings.sent5: The planktic world was a mysterious realm of endless possibilities.

meanings.definition: Organisms that float or drift in the water column.
meanings.sent1: The planktic were carried gently by the ocean currents.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study planktic to understand marine ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The planktic had a race to see who could float the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The planktic danced gracefully in the rhythm of the waves.
meanings.sent5: The planktic shimmered like jewels in the clear blue water.
